instruction: [INST] Analyze this file to learn MacBook motherboard repair. The 'definitions' section explains key technical terms. The 'threads' section contains real-world repair discussions. Use both sections to understand and learn how to troubleshoot MacBook issues. Posts from username 'larossmann' , 'dukefawks' , and '2informaticos' are posts from trusted experts.[/INST]

definitions.820-2530: What is 820-2530? a LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER.
definitions.PPBUS_G3H: What is PPBUS_G3H? Main system power rail that charges the battery, or is power from the battery, that everything else is powered from. .
definitions.PP3V3_S5: What is PP3V3_S5? PP3V3_S5 is a 3.3v power rail when the system is in an S5 soft off power state.
definitions.ISL6259: What is ISL6259? This is a charging chip for Macbook motherboards from 2010 through 2015.
definitions.ISL6258: What is ISL6258? This is a charging chip for Macbook motherboards from 2008 through 2009.
definitions.R7021: What is R7021? Current sense resistor between charger current sense shunt resistor and ISL6259. When these resistors fail the ISL6259 cannot gauge how much current is being drawn from the charger, which will cause the ISL6259 to stop drawing power from the charger as a safety precaution. Symptoms are low voltage on PPBUS_G3H around 4v, quarter fan spin, or battery not charging..

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-2530</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> Battery is not charging.
threads.message:
HI all.

This is not a liquid dmg board. How ever battery ia not charging.

<SIGNAL>PPBUS_G3H</SIGNAL> is 8v when power connected. WHen battery connected it is 12.6v
it runs from the battery and can see the battery indicator charging but it is not. 

I tried to get 12.6V on ppbus replacing both sides current sensing resistors,U 7000 , <TRANSISTOR>Q7020</TRANSISTOR> and <TRANSISTOR>Q7021</TRANSISTOR> no change.

<SIGNAL>PP3V3_S5</SIGNAL> is fine.

Any clue?

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-2530</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> Battery is not charging.
threads.message: Also on <CAPACITOR>C7025</CAPACITOR> pin 1 in 12.6V pin 2 is 8V.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-2530</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> Battery is not charging.
threads.message:
Hi What I found Charger Bgate in <CAPACITOR>C7026</CAPACITOR> is high 8v. <TRANSISTOR>Q7050</TRANSISTOR> Gate close as source and the gate same voltage 8v.
I replaced <CAPACITOR>C7026</CAPACITOR> and <TRANSISTOR>Q7050</TRANSISTOR> still no luck

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-2530</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> Battery is not charging.
threads.message:
"<SIGNAL>PPBUS_G3H</SIGNAL> is 8v when power connected. WHen battery connected it is 12.6v"
Are you really sure is not viceversa?

Did you try known good battery?
Did you solder correct <CHIP>ISL6258</CHIP> there (not <CHIP>ISL6259</CHIP>)?

Be sure to have correct value for <RESISTOR>R7021</RESISTOR>/23 and R 7031/47.
Post exact voltage for <SIGNAL>CHGR_A</SIGNAL>/BMON.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-2530</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> Battery is not charging.
threads.message:
HI 2Info,

Solved. my stupid mistake. I have been using ISL 6259 chips. Replaced with 6258 solved.

Again Thank you very much  for guiding and teaching me. Until i trouble you again have a great weekend.:)
